title: How to Make Sweet Potato and Cranberry Muffins

steps.headline: Peel the sweet potato.
steps.description: Cut into cubes and place in a large pot to boil until soft.

steps.headline: Prepare the dry mixture.
steps.description: Sift the flour in a medium bowl. Add the sugar, baking powder, and cayenne powder. Mix well.

steps.headline: Use a separate large bowl to whisk the egg and oil together.
steps.description: Add the dry ingredients, in small amounts. Add the yoghurt and bacon. Mix thoroughly.

steps.headline: Add the sweet potato cubes and cranberries to the mix.
Measure and pour the batter into a muffin baking tray.
steps.description: Fill it about 3/4 full, to allow room to rise while baking. Garnish the tops with almond flakes.

text: Peel the sweet potato. Cut into cubes and place in a large pot to boil until soft. Preheat the oven to 175ºC/350ºF.  Prepare the dry mixture. Sift the flour in a medium bowl. Add the sugar, baking powder, and cayenne powder. Mix well. Use a separate large bowl to whisk the egg and oil together. Add the dry ingredients, in small amounts. Add the yoghurt and bacon. Mix thoroughly. Add the sweet potato cubes and cranberries to the mix.  Measure and pour the batter into a muffin baking tray. Fill it about 3/4 full, to allow room to rise while baking. Garnish the tops with almond flakes. Bake for about 25 minutes.  Finished.
